definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: I must abandon vessel after piracy in the west mouth of Malacca Strait.
sentences.chinese: 我船在马六甲海峡西出口被海盗抢劫后必须弃船。

sentences.english: That includes, for example, the Strait of Malacca.
sentences.chinese: 例如，那包括马六甲海峡。

sentences.english: Four-fifths of China's entire supply of oil comes through the Strait of Malacca.
sentences.chinese: 中国五分之四的石油供应要经马六甲海峡。

sentences.english: The Strait of Malacca is one of the worlds hottest and most crucial strategic choke points.
sentences.chinese: 马六甲海峡是世界上最危险和最重要的战略要冲之一。

sentences.english: Nearly nine-tenths of its oil imports cross the Indian Ocean and pass through the Malacca Strait.
sentences.chinese: 它的石油进口的十分之九要经过印度洋和马六甲海峡。

pinyin: Huo4 er3 mu4 zi1 Hai3 xia2
Zhi2 bu4 luo2 tuo2 Hai3 xia2

definition: Gwadar Port on Arabian Sea in Pakistani province of Baluchistan
Malacca or Melaka (town and state in Malaysia), also strait between Malaysia and Sumatra

pinyin: Da2 da2 ni2 er3 Hai3 xia2

definition: Sunda Strait between Sumatra and Java
